Detailed Description

This class represents the sum squared error objective functional of a multilayer perceptron. This objective functional is used in data modeling problems, such as function regression, pattern recognition or time series prediction.

See also:
MultilayerPerceptron.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Flood::SumSquaredError::SumSquaredError ( MultilayerPerceptron *  newMultilayerPerceptron,
InputTargetDataSet *  newInputTargetDataSet 
)

General constructor. It creates a sum squared error objective functional object associated to a multilayer perceptron and measured on an input-target data set. It also initializes all the rest of class members to their default values:

  • Numerical epsilon method: Relative.
  • Numerical differentiation method: Central differences.
  • Number of evaluations = 0.
  • Numerical epsilon: 1.0e-6.
  • Display = true.

Parameters:
newMultilayerPerceptron Pointer to a multilayer perceptron object.
newInputTargetDataSet Pointer to an input-target data set object.

Definition at line 42 of file SumSquaredError.cpp.

References inputTargetDataSet.

Flood::SumSquaredError::SumSquaredError ( void   ) 

Default constructor. It creates a sum squared error objective functional object not associated to any multilayer perceptron and not measured on any input-target data set. It also initializes all the rest of class members to their default values:

  • Numerical epsilon method: Relative.
  • Numerical differentiation method: Central differences.
  • Number of evaluations = 0.
  • Numerical epsilon: 1.0e-6.
  • Display = true.

double Flood::SumSquaredError::calculateEvaluation ( void   )  [virtual]

This method returns the objective functional value of a multilayer perceptron according to the sum squared error on an input-target data set.

Vector< double > Flood::SumSquaredError::calculateSquaredErrors ( void   ) 

This method returns a vector containing the squared error values between the outputs from the neural network and the targets in the data set. The size of this vector is the number of samples in the input-target data set.

Vector< double > Flood::SumSquaredError::calculateGradient ( void   )  [virtual]

This method returns the the sum squared error function gradient of a multilayer perceptron on an input-target data set. It uses the error back-propagation method.

See also:
calculateEvaluation(void).

Reimplemented from Flood::ObjectiveFunctional.

Matrix< double > Flood::SumSquaredError::calculateJacobian ( void   ) 

This method returns the Jacobian matrix of the sum squared error function, whose elements are given by the derivatives of the squared errors data set with respect to the neural parameters. The Jacobian matrix here is computed using numerical differentiation.

See also:
calculateJacobian(void).

This method is not fully implemented, and it should be finished.

Matrix< double > Flood::SumSquaredError::calculateJacobianTest ( void   ) 

This method returns the Jacobian matrix of the sum squared error function, whose elements are given by the derivatives of the squared errors data set with respect to the neural parameters. The Jacobian matrix here is computed using a back-propagation algorithm.

See also:
calculateJacobianTest(void).

void Flood::SumSquaredError::saveInputTargetAndOutput ( char *  filename  ) 

This method saves to a data file the inputs and the targets in the input-target data set, together with the outputs from the multilayer perceptron for that inputs.
